00022 #include "chipstream/AnalysisStreamExpression.h"

00024 AnalysisStreamExpression::AnalysisStreamExpression(bool doGenoTypes, bool doStrand, bool aOnly) {
00025     setupSelfDoc(*this);
00026     m_DoGenotypes = doGenoTypes;
00027     m_DoStrand = doStrand;
00028     m_Aonly = aOnly;
00029     setOptValue("genotype", m_DoGenotypes);
00030     setOptValue("strand", m_DoStrand);
00031     setOptValue("allele-a", m_Aonly);
00032 }
00033 
00034 /** 
00035  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00036  * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00037  */
00038 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> AnalysisStreamExpression::getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00039     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00040     SelfDoc::Opt doGenoType = {"genotype", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00041                           "Should genotype probesets also be summarized. [experimental] "};
00042     opts.push_back(doGenoType);
00043 
00044     SelfDoc::Opt doStrand = {"strand", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00045                           "Should genotype probesets be separated by strand or just A and B alleles. [experimental]"};
00046     opts.push_back(doStrand);
00047     SelfDoc::Opt aOnly = {"allele-a", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00048                           "Should only the A allele be summarized? (Useful with pm-sum where A and B give same results). [experimental]"};
00049     opts.push_back(aOnly);
00050     return opts;
00051 }

00053 /** 
00054  * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00055  * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00056  */
00057 void AnalysisStreamExpression::setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00058     doc.setDocName("expr");
00059     doc.setDocDescription("Does expression summarization on probesets.");
00060     doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00061 }

00063 QuantExprMethod *AnalysisStreamExpression::getQuantExprMethod() {
00064     return m_QExprMethod;

00067 /** 
00068  * Set the object for summarizing an individual probe set.
00069  * @param qMethod - Quantification object.
00070  */
00071 void AnalysisStreamExpression::setQuantMethod(QuantMethod *qMethod) {
00072     QuantExprMethod *qeMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantExprMethod *>(qMethod);
00073     if(qeMethod == NULL)
00074       Err::errAbort("AnalysisStreamExpression::setQuantMethod() - Can only set QuantExprMethod's in AnalysisStreamExpression.");
00075     m_QMethod = qeMethod;
00076     m_QExprMethod = qeMethod;
00077 }

00079 /** 
00080  * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00081  * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00082  * @return SelfDoc
00083  */
00084 SelfDoc AnalysisStreamExpression::explainSelf() { 
00085     SelfDoc doc;
00086     setupSelfDoc(doc);
00087     return doc;
00088 }
00089   
00090 /** 
00091  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00092  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00093  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00094  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00095  * 
00096  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00097  * 
00098  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00099  */
00100 SelfCreate *AnalysisStreamExpression::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00101     SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00102     bool doGenotype = false;
00103     bool doStrand = false;
00104     bool aOnly = false;
00105     fillInValue(doGenotype, "genotype", param, doc);
00106     fillInValue(doStrand, "strand", param, doc);
00107     fillInValue(aOnly, "allele-a", param, doc);
00108     AnalysisStreamExpression *stream = new AnalysisStreamExpression(doGenotype, doStrand, aOnly);
00109     return stream;
00110 }
00111 
00112 /** 
00113  * Fill in psNewGroup with probes from psGroup based on the block
00114  * indexes in the blocks vector. To divide a genotyping probeset
00115  * based on Allele (A or B) you would use the 1,3 blocks for A and
00116  * 2,4 blocks for B. If you just want one strand of a particular
00117  * allele then it would be 1 for A+, 2 for B+, 3 for A- and 4 for
00118  * B-. This is sensitive to the vagaries of the genotyping probeset
00119  * structure which is poorly documented and ever
00120  * "innovating"... Eventually this should be moved to the ChipLayout
00121  * class or ProbeSet class.
00122  * 
00123  * @param psNewGroup 
00124  * @param psGroup 
00125  * @param blocks 
00126  */
00127 void AnalysisStreamExpression::fillInProbeSetFromBlocks(ProbeSetGroup &psNewGroup, ProbeSetGroup &psGroup,
00128                               const std::vector<short> &blocks) {
00129     std::set<probeid_t> toKeep;
00130     const ProbeSet *ps = psGroup.probeSets[0];
00131     for(uint32_t blockIx = 0; blockIx < blocks.size(); blockIx++) {
00132       int start = 0;
00133       // figure out where to start for this block
00134       for(uint32_t groupIx = 0; groupIx < blocks[blockIx]; groupIx++) {
00135         start += ps->atomsPerGroup[groupIx];
00136       }
00137       for(uint32_t bIx = start; bIx < ps->atomsPerGroup[blocks[blockIx]] + start; bIx++) {
00138         Atom *a = ps->atoms[bIx];
00139         for(uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx < a->probes.size(); pIx++) {
00140           toKeep.insert(a->probes[pIx]->id);
00141         }
00142       }
00143     }
00144     makeSelectProbesetGroup(psNewGroup, toKeep, psGroup);
00145 }
00146 
00147 void AnalysisStreamExpression::fillInGroup(ProbeSetGroup &psAllele, ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, int blockIx, const char *basename, const char *suffix) {
00148     const ProbeSet *ps = psGroup.probeSets[0];
00149     std::vector<short> blocks;
00150     blocks.push_back(blockIx);
00151     fillInProbeSetFromBlocks(psAllele, psGroup, blocks);
00152     std::string name = ps->name + ToStr(suffix);
00153     FreezArray(psAllele.probeSets[0]->name);
00154     psAllele.name = psAllele.probeSets[0]->name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00155     psAllele.probeSets[0]->psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
00156 }
00157 
00158 /** 
00159  * Do the analysis for a particular group of probe sets. If we see a
00160  * genotype probeset and user wishes it try to break it up into
00161  * expression probesets. The code for dividing up a genotyping
00162  * probeset should probably live in ChipLayout eventually, but for
00163  * now the initial implementation is here.
00164  * 
00165  * @param psGroup - Collection of probe sets to get probes from.
00166  * @param layout - How probes/probesets are laid out on chip.
00167  * @param iMart - Object containing raw data values for all chips.
00168  * @param doReport - Should the quantification report object be called?
00169  * @param alleleSummaryOnly - this is a parameter that makes sense in the base class AnalysisStream::doAnalysis, but not here.  Included here only to make the inheritance work.  Feel free to ignore.
00170  * 
00171  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00172  */
00173 bool AnalysisStreamExpression::doAnalysis(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, IntensityMart &iMart, bool doReport, bool alleleSummaryOnly) {
00174     bool success = true;
00175     std::vector<ProbeSetGroup *> toRun;
00176     std::vector<ProbeSetGroup> psAlleles;
00177     if(psGroup.probeSets.size() <= 0) {
00178       Err::errAbort("Can't have probeset groups with no probesets.");
00179     }
00180     ///@todo handle Marker type probesets
00181     if(psGroup.probeSets[0]->psType == ProbeSet::GenoType && m_DoGenotypes &&
00182        (psGroup.probeSets[0]->numGroups == 2 || psGroup.probeSets[0]->numGroups == 4)) {
00183       const ProbeSet *ps = psGroup.probeSets[0];
00184 
00185       if(m_DoStrand && ps->numGroups == 4) {
00186 
00187         psAlleles.resize(4);
00188         short blockIx = 0;
00189         fillInGroup(psAlleles[blockIx], psGroup, blockIx, ps->name, "-A-F");
00190         toRun.push_back(&psAlleles[blockIx++]);
00191 
00192         if(!m_Aonly) {
00193           fillInGroup(psAlleles[blockIx], psGroup, blockIx, ps->name, "-B-F");
00194           toRun.push_back(&psAlleles[blockIx++]);
00195         }
00196         fillInGroup(psAlleles[blockIx], psGroup, blockIx, ps->name, "-A-R");
00197         toRun.push_back(&psAlleles[blockIx++]);
00198         if(!m_Aonly) {
00199           fillInGroup(psAlleles[blockIx], psGroup, blockIx, ps->name, "-B-R");
00200           toRun.push_back(&psAlleles[blockIx++]);
00201         }
00202       }
00203       else {
00204         std::string name;
00205         psAlleles.resize(2);
00206         std::vector<short> blocksA, blocksB;
00207         short blockIx = 0;
00208         blocksA.push_back(blockIx++);
00209         blocksB.push_back(blockIx++);
00210         if(ps->numGroups == 4) {
00211           blocksA.push_back(blockIx++);
00212           blocksB.push_back(blockIx++);
00213         }
00214 
00215         fillInProbeSetFromBlocks(psAlleles[0], psGroup, blocksA);
00216         blockIx = 0;
00217         name = ps->name + ToStr("-A");
00218         //
00219         FreezArray(psAlleles[blockIx].name);
00220         psAlleles[blockIx].name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00221         //
00222         FreezArray(psAlleles[blockIx].probeSets[0]->name);
00223         psAlleles[blockIx].probeSets[0]->name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00224         psAlleles[blockIx].probeSets[0]->psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
00225         //
00226         toRun.push_back(&psAlleles[blockIx]);
00227 
00228         fillInProbeSetFromBlocks(psAlleles[1], psGroup, blocksB);
00229         if(!m_Aonly) {
00230           blockIx = 1;
00231           name = ps->name + ToStr("-B");
00232           //
00233           FreezArray(psAlleles[blockIx].name);
00234           psAlleles[blockIx].name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00235           //
00236           FreezArray(psAlleles[blockIx].probeSets[0]->name);
00237           psAlleles[blockIx].probeSets[0]->name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00238           psAlleles[blockIx].probeSets[0]->psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
00239           //
00240           toRun.push_back(&psAlleles[blockIx]);
00241         }
00242       }
00243     }
00244     else if((psGroup.probeSets[0]->psType == ProbeSet::Marker || psGroup.probeSets[0]->psType == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker) && m_DoGenotypes) {
00245       if(m_DoStrand) {
00246           psAlleles.resize(psGroup.probeSets[0]->atoms.size());
00247           for(int blockIx = 0; blockIx < psGroup.probeSets[0]->atoms.size(); blockIx++) {
00248               std::string suffix = "-" + ToStr(psGroup.probeSets[0]->atoms[blockIx]->getAlleleCode()) +
00249                   "-" + ToStr(psGroup.probeSets[0]->atoms[blockIx]->getContextCode());
00250               fillInGroup(psAlleles[blockIx], psGroup, blockIx, psGroup.probeSets[0]->name, suffix.c_str());
00251               toRun.push_back(&psAlleles[blockIx]);
00252           }
00253       } else {
00254           std::string name;
00255           std::vector< std::vector<short> > blocks;
00256 
00257           for(short blockIx = 0; blockIx < psGroup.probeSets[0]->atoms.size(); blockIx++) {
00258               int allele = psGroup.probeSets[0]->atoms[blockIx]->getAlleleCode();
00259               if(blocks.size() <= allele)
00260                 blocks.resize(allele+1);
00261               blocks[allele].push_back(blockIx);
00262           }
00263 
00264           psAlleles.resize(blocks.size());
00265           for(int allele=0; allele<psAlleles.size(); allele++) {
00266               if(blocks[allele].size() > 0) {
00267                 fillInProbeSetFromBlocks(psAlleles[allele], psGroup, blocks[allele]);
00268                 name = ToStr(psGroup.probeSets[0]->name) + "-" + ToStr(allele);
00269                 FreezArray(psAlleles[allele].name);
00270                 psAlleles[allele].name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00271                 FreezArray(psAlleles[allele].probeSets[0]->name);
00272                 psAlleles[allele].probeSets[0]->name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00273                 psAlleles[allele].probeSets[0]->psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
00274                 toRun.push_back(&psAlleles[allele]);
00275               }
00276           }
00277       }
00278     }
00279     else {
00280       toRun.push_back(&psGroup);
00281     }
00282     for(uint32_t gIx = 0; gIx < toRun.size(); gIx++) {
00283       ProbeSetGroup &group = *toRun[gIx];
00284       //std::cout << *(group.probeSets[0]) << '\n';
00285       if(m_QMethod->setUp(group, iMart, m_CStreams, *m_PmAdjust)) {
00286         m_QMethod->computeEstimate();
00287         if(doReport) {
00288           for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Reporters.size(); i++) {
00289             m_Reporters[i]->report(group, *m_QMethod, iMart, m_CStreams, *m_PmAdjust);
00290           }
00291         }
00292       }
00293       else {
00294         Verbose::out(5, "Warning setup failed for name: " + ToStr(group.name));
00295         success = false;
00296       }
00297       if(!success && doReport) {
00298         for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Reporters.size(); i++) {
00299           m_Reporters[i]->reportFailure(group, *m_QMethod, iMart, m_CStreams, *m_PmAdjust);
00300         }
00301       }
00302     }
00303     for(uint32_t gIx = 0; gIx < psAlleles.size(); gIx++) {
00304       ProbeSetGroup &pG = psAlleles[gIx];
00305       pG.ownMem = false;
00306       FreezArray(psAlleles[gIx].name);
00307       for(uint32_t psIx = 0; psIx < pG.probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00308         delete pG.probeSets[psIx];
00309       }
00310     }
00311     return success;
00312 }
00313 
00314 /** 
00315  * Make a new probeset group which is a subset of the original based on the
00316  * probeset ids contained in the goodIds set.
00317  * 
00318  * @param selectGroup - New probeset group to be filled in.
00319  * @param goodIds - Set with ids of probes to keep.
00320  * @param psGroup - Original probeset to get probes and structure from.
00321  */
00322 void AnalysisStreamExpression::makeSelectProbesetGroup(ProbeSetGroup &selectGroup, 
00323                                       std::set<probeid_t> &goodIds,
00324                                       ProbeSetGroup &psGroup) {
00325     selectGroup.ownMem = true;
00326     selectGroup.name = Util::cloneString(psGroup.name);
00327     selectGroup.probeSets.resize(psGroup.probeSets.size());
00328     selectGroup.probeSetNames.resize(psGroup.probeSetNames.size());
00329     for(uint32_t nameIx = 0; nameIx < psGroup.probeSetNames.size(); nameIx++) {
00330       selectGroup.probeSetNames[nameIx] = Util::cloneString(psGroup.probeSetNames[nameIx]);
00331     }
00332     for(uint32_t psIx = 0; psIx < psGroup.probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00333       const ProbeSet *ps = psGroup.probeSets[psIx];
00334       ProbeSet *newPs = new ProbeSet();
00335       newPs->name = Util::cloneString(ps->name);
00336       newPs->psType = ps->psType;
00337       newPs->numGroups = ps->numGroups;
00338       newPs->atomsPerGroup.resize(ps->atomsPerGroup.size());
00339       std::copy(ps->atomsPerGroup.begin(), ps->atomsPerGroup.end(), newPs->atomsPerGroup.begin());
00340       newPs->atoms.resize(ps->atoms.size());
00341       for(uint32_t atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps->atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00342         Atom *a = ps->atoms[atomIx];
00343         Atom *newAtom = new Atom();
00344         std::vector<Probe *> goodProbes;
00345         goodProbes.reserve(a->probes.size());
00346         newAtom->id = a->id;
00347         bool expectingMismatches = false;
00348         // if we have at two probes, a multiple of two number of probes
00349         // and the first two probes are a pm & mm we think there should
00350         // be mm probes.
00351         if(a->probes.size() > 1 && a->probes.size() % 2 == 0 && 
00352            (Probe::isPm(*(a->probes[0])) && Probe::isMm(*(a->probes[1])))) {
00353           expectingMismatches = true;
00354         }
00355         for(uint32_t probeIx = 0; probeIx < a->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00356           Probe *p = a->probes[probeIx];
00357           if(goodIds.find(p->id) != goodIds.end()) {
00358             Probe *newProbe = Probe::cloneProbe(*p);
00359             goodProbes.push_back(newProbe);
00360             // If we're expecting mismatches add the next probe as it should be MM of PM/MM pair.
00361             if(expectingMismatches) {
00362               probeIx++;
00363               if(probeIx >= a->probes.size()) {
00364                 Err::errAbort("makeSelectProbesetGroup() - Expecting a mismatch for probeset group: " + 
00365                               ToStr(psGroup.name) + " but didn't have enough probes.");
00366               }
00367               Probe *newMMProbe = Probe::cloneProbe(*(a->probes[probeIx]));
00368               if(!Probe::isMm(*newMMProbe)) {
00369                 Err::errAbort("makeSelectProbesetGroup() - Expecting a mismatch for probeset group: " + 
00370                               ToStr(psGroup.name) + " got non-MM probe instead.");
00371               }
00372               goodProbes.push_back(newMMProbe);
00373             }
00374           }
00375         }
00376         newAtom->probes.resize(goodProbes.size());
00377         std::copy(goodProbes.begin(), goodProbes.end(), newAtom->probes.begin());
00378         newPs->atoms[atomIx] = newAtom;
00379       }
00380       selectGroup.probeSets[psIx] = newPs;
00381     }
00382 }
